en: It may seem obvious, but sentences you write yourself look the most natural.

en: Fundamentally, you're not practicing anything by translating, so even if you say that you can't do it, once you've set your sights on a similar sentence you've seen before that is more natural yet does not quite convey the original sentence's nuances, translation proves to be an act that is quite addicting.

zh: 书的每一章都以一段关于作者生活的引言开始：书里的片段，路边问陌生人的问题，或者是女朋友的喊叫。
